## Store.putCookie() method

Adds a new [Cookie](./tough-cookie.cookie.md) to the store. The implementation SHOULD replace any existing cookie with the same `domain`<!-- -->, `path`<!-- -->, and `key` properties.

**Signature:**

```typescript
putCookie(cookie: Cookie, callback: ErrorCallback): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

cookie


</td><td>

[Cookie](./tough-cookie.cookie.md)


</td><td>

The cookie to store.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

callback


</td><td>

[ErrorCallback](./tough-cookie.errorcallback.md)


</td><td>

A function to call when the cookie has been stored or an error has occurred.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

void

## Remarks

- Depending on the nature of the implementation, it's possible that between the call to `fetchCookie` and `putCookie` that a duplicate `putCookie` can occur.

- The [Cookie](./tough-cookie.cookie.md) object MUST NOT be modified; as the caller has already updated the `creation` and `lastAccessed` properties.
